info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:57PM MDT until July 05 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MDT FOR CENTRAL FERGUS COUNTY... At 256 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 13 miles north of Lewistown, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Localized flash flooding possible. Locations impacted include... Roy, Fergus, Hilger and Christina. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
